channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Markets' Summer Vacation Is Over
item.description: Five charts show the tests ahead for stocks, bonds and energy.

item.title: I give my mother’s ailing next-door neighbor $500 a month. She agreed to sell me her house, although she’ll continue to live there. Is this a good plan?
item.description: “She has a next-door neighbor who is 72 and disabled, and has even more serious problems.”

item.title: How to Lose Money on the World's Most Popular Investment Theme
item.description: Pity the investors in the three artificial-intelligence-themed exchange-traded funds that managed to lose money this year.

item.title: ‘He’s 70 and fairly wealthy’: I met the love of my life three years ago. How do I politely ask that he include me in his will?
item.description: “His two sons are against any kind of commitment between us, as their dad has had two failed marriages.”

item.title: White House Races to Lend Billions in Climate Funds Before Election
item.description: The Energy Department’s Loan Programs Office was turbocharged by the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act, but it has only used a tiny fraction of its capacit...

item.title: ‘I was heartbroken’: My friend set up a $5,000 GoFundMe for veterinary bills after her cat died. I want to donate $200. Is it better to do so anonymously?
item.description: “She tried desperately to save her companion, and the vet did everything they could but it was hopeless.”

item.title: Retail Needs Some Therapy as Cautious Consumers Trade Down
item.description: Low-income consumers are cutting back on necessities, while better-off households are looking for bargains.

item.title: Beer-making beyond planet Earth: How space-age technology could shape the industry
item.description: A new study from the University of Florida explores the effects of a microgravity environment on the beer-production process

item.title: Airbnb Should Be a Sleeper Hit
item.description: Winter came early for the stock, but Airbnb is still outgrowing the industry, with new services offering potential upside.

item.title: 401(k) millionaires hit a record high — and it seems this ‘slacker’ generation is finally getting its act together
item.description: The trick: Starting early and contributing “consistently”
